New Records: Giancarlo Stanton tied Carlos Beltrán and Nelson Cruz for the most homers in the first 35 career playoff games and moved into a tie with Aaron Judge and Babe Ruth for fourth in club history
Key Match Events: Yankees scored two runs in the ninth inning off Emmanuel Clase to win the game
Brayan Rocchio booted Alex Verdugo’s RBI grounder for an error leading to a Yankees run
Emmanuel Clase struggled in the ninth inning with three singles and two runs allowed
Giancarlo Stanton hit a three-run homer in the sixth inning
Aaron Judge hit a two-run homer in the eighth inning
Pre-Game Insights: Yankees manager Aaron Boone emphasized the team's resilience after a tough loss the previous night
New York's bullpen was a focus with Tommy Kahnle being used in high-leverage situations
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone praised the team's grit and resilience
Stephen Vogt highlighted the Guardians' determination despite facing elimination
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees' bullpen struggled in high-leverage situations for the second straight night
Game 4 marked the Guardians' second straight loss and they faced elimination
The Guardians' fielding and baserunning miscues contributed to their loss
Others: The game was played at Progressive Field with a crowd of 35,263
Yankees' Carlos Rodón was scheduled to start in the next game against the Guardians' Tanner Bibee
